The three bedrooms were clean and spacious and chocolate treats and a selection of creme breads were set out for us. We got in very late on Friday and it was still a very easy check in. The house has a fair amount of land that allows you to enjoy nature and disconnect a bit. It was fun to pet the donkeys and look at the emus next door too.
During my trip I had an allergic reaction to seafood and Ruthie sent over some Benadryl. It was so kind of them. When I told her my son was fascinated with her record player (Ruthie does auctions so the house has neat knickknacks and decorations) she secretly dropped off some albums so he and I could bond over how I used to have to listen to my favorite songs. It was quite fun playing records and singing to Queen.
As far as location it was an easy drive to Oxford and it cut my drive back to New Orleans by an hour going home on Sunday- Giving us more time to enjoy this wonderful little getaway.
I just keep thinking, ugh I hate to write all this good stuff, because when I go back again, the secret will be out and it will be booked! Thank you Ruthie, we had a great time.

This is a perfect spot for a group wanting to fish or hunt. Very close to boat launch, Hugh White State Park and golf course. Cabin is basic and has just about everything you would need. Two bedrooms upstairs each held a double bed and a single. There is a couch downstairs, but not a sleeper. Host were very friendly and helpful. We rented last-minute. There were coffee and snacks in a basket on the kitchen table. However there was no sugar. There was no cooking oil at the cabin but they brought some right over. They were also helpful when I accidentally locked us out of the cabin! There is a porch swing that looks down over the pond, which I enjoyed in the evenings after a day of fishing.
The only reason I did not give 5 stars were for the following: the lighting, especially in the kitchen need to be brighter. The couch in living room was uncomfortable. There was no wifi (which I knew when I booked). It would be nice to have a TV in the bedroom. Also the double bed was way too small for my husband and I. He ended up sleeping on the single. For a group of guys on a fishing trip, this would not be an issue, but for a couple it would be nice to have had at least a queen-size bed in one of the rooms.
We would rent this place again if we go back to Grenada Lake to fish!
Thanks, Brian for a nice week away!

First let me start off by saying - 2020 has been an unkind year and extremely rough on my family. When searching for a place to stay this Labor Day weekend, I was in search of a place tucked in the woods, away from everything, with the ability to allow me to just disconnect and recharge my soul... that is exactly what I found here.
My family of 5 (3 middle school aged children) and our dog found the perfect little hideaway with Brian's cabin. The second we entered the cabin, we were welcomed with: a basket of snacks, a bookshelf full of games (chicken dominoes was our favorite), and enough privacy and space to really enjoy our time together.
Brian and his wife really took the extra step and went the extra mile in their thoughtfulness - from toiletries to a binder full of local restaurant menus to messages with suggested hiking trails, their hospitality truly was so appreciated and heartfelt.
I especially loved the porch swing, waking up at 6:30 am and sitting outside by myself drinking a cup of coffee while taking it all in - the pure serenity. So needed. So appreciated. So perfect.
Family time consisted of sitting in the dining room table playing Chicken Dominoes, hiking nearby trails, visiting Grenada Lake and just relaxing in the cabin. Spotty service with our cellphone carrier but that's what we were looking for! So needed. So appreciated. So perfect.
The pictures do not give this cabin justice.
Fair warning: make sure to wear your DEET! Doggo came back home with lots of ticks... welp. However, that just comes with the territory.
Can't wait to come back again!

review_text: Very nice stay at the lake. Cabin is just as pictured, has a homey feel & was very clean! Close to Lake Grenada & several boat launches within 5 minutes (Piney Woods the closest at 2 miles). The cabin has a well stocked kitchen to make meals if you choose. A small chest freezer to store your catch was a very nice amenity along with a full size washer & dryer. You can tell the owners tried to think of everything to enhance the guest experience. Very large parking area for boats & trucks. Dogwood Golf course & Hugh White State Park 2 minutes away. Town is only 6 miles away. Bait & tackle store provides shiners, minnows & and a place to buy your fishing license. Great water pressure & the A/C was fantastic. The cabin was very comfortable for my husband & I and our best friend. Though fishing was tough due to the recent change in lake water levels, the cabin was perfect for our stay. The owners were very accommodating and allowed an early check in. Don’t hesitate to book your stay today!

review_text: Such a lovely place, such a lovely stay. We sat on the back porch every night and watched the fireflies come out while a whippoorwill sang. Inside the cabin was snug and soundless, and full of the comforting smell of natural cedar on the walls. The Goffs have two cabins positioned at just the perfect angle that even though there were guests at the other cabin, we really couldn’t see or hear each other. We had everything we needed and instructions were clear. Mattresses/bedding feels new and comfortable. Closets have plenty of space; kitchen layout provides plenty of counter space. Bathroom is charming, clean and comfortable. The Goffs were kind, helpful, responsive hosts. It was an absolute wonderful stay. In case you are coming to the lake to hunt or fish, there is an extra chest freezer for your needs as well as a cleaning-table out back. Such a thoughtfully and tastefully laid out cabin. Thank you, Goff family!
